Submodules¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.acv_logit module¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.acv_logit.acv_logit(w, X, Ycode, lambda2=0.0)¶

An approximate leave-one-out estimator of predictive likelihood for accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression with elastic net regularization[1]

Compute and return an approximate leave-one-out estimator (LOOE) and its standard error of predivtive likelihood for accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression penalized by elastic net regularization.

Parameters:
  • w – weight vector ((1,N)-shape np.float64 array)
  • X – input feature matrix ((M, N)-shape np.float64 array)
  • Ycode – binary matrix representing the class to which the corresponding feature vector belongs((M, 2)-shape np.int64 array)
  • lambda2 – coefficient of the l2 regularization term (float value). Default value is zero.
Returns:

LOOE, ERR (float, float)

References

[1]: T. Obuchi and Y. Kabashima, arXiv:1711.05420

Note

In this method, expected shape is different from the MATLAB implementation. (MATLAB -> w is a (N,1) matrix, Python -> w is (1,N)-shape np.float64 array)

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.acv_mlr module¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.acv_mlr.acv_mlr(wV, X, Ycode, Np=None, lambda2=0.0)¶

An approximate leave-one-out estimator of predictive likelihood for multinomial accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression with elastic norm regularization[1]

Compute and return an very simplified approximation of a leave-one-out estimator (LOOE) and its standard error of predivtive likelihood for multinomial accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression penalized by elastic net regularization.

Parameters:
  • wV – weight vectors (p, N)-shape np.float64 array
  • X – input feature matrix (M, N)-shape np.float64 array
  • Ycode – class representative matrix (M, p)-shape np.int64 array
  • Np – number of classes (int value)
  • lambda2 – coefficient of the l2 regularization term (float value) Default value is zero.
Returns:

LOOE, ERR (float, float)

References

[1]: T. Obuchi and Y. Kabashima, arXiv:1711.05420

Note

In this method, expected shape is different from the MATLAB implementation. (MATLAB -> w is a (N, p) matrix, Python -> w is (p, N)-shape np.float64 array) (This is due to sklearn package output form.)

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.prob_logit module¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.prob_logit.prob_logit(x)¶

calc accelerated_cv_on_mlr probability from weight vector x

Parameters:x – M dimensional vector ((M,)-shape np.float64 object)
Returns:probability ((M, 2)-shape np.float64 object)

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.prob_multinomial module¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.prob_multinomial.prob_multinomial(uV)¶

calc softmax probability from weight vectors x

Parameters:uV – M p-dimensional vectors ((M, p)-shape np.float64 object)
Returns:M p-dimensional probability vectors ((M, p)-shape np.float64 object)

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.saacv_logit module¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.saacv_logit.saacv_logit(w, X, Ycode, lambda2=0.0)¶

A further simplified approximation of a leave-one-out estimator of predictive likelihood for accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression with elastic net regularization[1]

Compute and return an very simplified approximation of a leave-one-out estimator (LOOE) and its standard error of predictive likelihood for accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression penalized by elastic net loss.

Parameters:
  • w – weight vector ((1,N)-shape np.float64 array)
  • X – input feature matrix ((M, N)-shape np.float64 array)
  • Ycode – binary matrix representing the class to which the corresponding feature vector belongs ((M, 2)-shape np.int64 array)
  • lambda2 – Coefficient of the l2 regularization term (float value) Default value is zero.
Returns:

LOOE, ERR (float, float)

References

[1]: T. Obuchi and Y. Kabashima, arXiv:1711.05420

Note

In this method, expected shape is different from the MATLAB implementation. (MATLAB -> w is a (N,1) matrix, Python -> w is (1,N)-shape np.float64 array)

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.saacv_mlr module¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.saacv_mlr.saacv_mlr(wV, X, Ycode, Np=None, lambda2=0.0)¶

A further simplified approximation of a leave-one-out estimator of predictive likelihood for multinomial accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression with elastic net regularization[1]

Compute and return an very simplified approximation of a leave-one-out estimator (LOOE) and its standard error of predictive likelihood for multinomial accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression penalized by l1 norm.

Parameters:
  • wV – weight vectors (p, N)-shape np.float64 array
  • X – input feature matrix (M, N)-shape np.float64 array
  • Ycode – class representative matrix (M, p)-shape np.int64 array
  • Np – number of classes (int value)
  • lambda2 – Coefficient of the l2 regularization term (float value) Default value is zero.
Returns:

LOOE, ERR (float, float)

References

[1]: T. Obuchi and Y. Kabashima, arXiv:1711.05420

Note

In this method, expected shape is different from the MATLAB implementation. (MATLAB -> w is a (N, p) matrix, Python -> w is (p, N)-shape np.float64 array) (This is due to sklearn package output form.)

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.saacv_mlr.update_chi(N, R, activated_positions, chi, chi_pre, gamma, lambda2, lambda2_threshold, mean_X_square)¶

accelerated_cv_on_mlr.acv_logit(w, X, Ycode, lambda2=0.0)¶

An approximate leave-one-out estimator of predictive likelihood for accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression with elastic net regularization[1]

Compute and return an approximate leave-one-out estimator (LOOE) and its standard error of predivtive likelihood for accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression penalized by elastic net regularization.

Parameters:
  • w – weight vector ((1,N)-shape np.float64 array)
  • X – input feature matrix ((M, N)-shape np.float64 array)
  • Ycode – binary matrix representing the class to which the corresponding feature vector belongs((M, 2)-shape np.int64 array)
  • lambda2 – coefficient of the l2 regularization term (float value). Default value is zero.
Returns:

LOOE, ERR (float, float)

References

[1]: T. Obuchi and Y. Kabashima, arXiv:1711.05420

Note

In this method, expected shape is different from the MATLAB implementation. (MATLAB -> w is a (N,1) matrix, Python -> w is (1,N)-shape np.float64 array)

An approximate leave-one-out estimator of predictive likelihood for multinomial accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression with elastic norm regularization[1]

Compute and return an very simplified approximation of a leave-one-out estimator (LOOE) and its standard error of predivtive likelihood for multinomial accelerated_cv_on_mlr regression penalized by elastic net regularization.

Parameters:
  • wV – weight vectors (p, N)-shape np.float64 array
  • X – input feature matrix (M, N)-shape np.float64 array
  • Ycode – class representative matrix (M, p)-shape np.int64 array
  • Np – number of classes (int value)
  • lambda2 – coefficient of the l2 regularization term (float value) Default value is zero.
Returns:

LOOE, ERR (float, float)

References

[1]: T. Obuchi and Y. Kabashima, arXiv:1711.05420

Note

In this method, expected shape is different from the MATLAB implementation. (MATLAB -> w is a (N, p) matrix, Python -> w is (p, N)-shape np.float64 array) (This is due to sklearn package output form.)
